intro: Dillenia montana, commonly known as the mountain dillenia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring and summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often hairy and woody. It produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Dillenia montana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests.
